{{Graphicnovelbox| <!--Wikipedia:WikiProject Comics--> |title=The Mystery of the Great Pyramid, Volume 1: Manetho's Papyrus |foreigntitle=Le MystÃ¨re de la Grande Pyramide, Tome 1 |image=<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:B&M GP1.jpg|200px]] --> |caption=Cover |publisher= |date= |series=[[Blake and Mortimer]] |main_char_team= |origpublication=[[Tintin (magazine)|Tintin Magazine]] |origissues= |origdate= March 23, 1950 to February 21, 1951 |origlanguage= [[French language|French]] |origisbn= |writers= |artists= |pencillers= |colorists= |transpublisher= Les Editions Blake et Mortimer, Cinebooks |transdate=1987, 2007 |transisbn= |translator= |previssue=[[The Secret of the Swordfish]] |nextissue=[[The Mystery of the Great Pyramid Volume 2: The Chamber of Horus]] }} '''''The Mystery of the Great Pyramid, Volume 1: Manetho's Papyrus''''' (Le MystÃ¨re de la Grande Pyramide, Tome 1) by the Belgian artist [[Edgar P. Jacobs]] was the fourth comic book in the [[Blake and Mortimer]] series, first published in ''[[Tintin (magazine)|Tintin]]'' from March 23, 1950 to February 21, 1951. It appeared in book format in 1954.
==Plot== Professor Philip Mortimer is going to [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]] for a holiday. He soon gets mixed up in a weird business with ancient papyrus, heretic kings, lost treasures, an old nemesis, and the murder of his friend; Captain Blake.
==English Publication== [[File:Blake and Mortimer Egyptian Mystery.jpg|thumb|left|A frame from the comic.]] ''The Mystery of the Great Pyramid, Vol. 1'' was first published in English by Les Editions Blake and Mortimer in 1987. In 1990, [[Catalan Communications|Comcat Comics]] planned to publish it as ''Secret of the Great Pyramid, Vol 1'', but the company went under before it could come out. It has been published by [[Cinebook Ltd]] in November 2007.
